title: Building A Successful Relationship With Stakeholders
optimized_headline: Unlocking Success: Key Strategies for Strong Stakeholder Relationships
raw_excerpt:
Show your value by moving beyond the technical
The post Building A Successful Relationship With Stakeholders appeared first on Towards Data Science.
raw_body:
Show your value by moving beyond the technical
The post Building A Successful Relationship With Stakeholders appeared first on Towards Data Science.
speedrun: A recent article emphasizes the importance of building strong relationships with stakeholders in any project. It highlights that merely focusing on technical skills isn't enough; effective communication and understanding stakeholder needs are crucial. For instance, engaging with stakeholders can lead to better project outcomes and satisfaction. This approach is increasingly relevant as projects become more collaborative and complex.
why_it_matters: Project teams can enhance their collaboration and success by understanding and addressing stakeholder needs directly.
This shift towards relationship-building reflects a broader trend in project management where communication is valued alongside technical expertise.

lenses.eli12: Think of stakeholder relationships like a friendship. Just as friends need to communicate and understand each other, project teams must engage with stakeholders. This connection can lead to better project results and happier participants. It matters because strong relationships can make projects smoother and more successful for everyone involved.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, focusing on stakeholder relationships means understanding user needs and expectations beyond just the product itself. This could improve user satisfaction and reduce costs related to misunderstandings. A practical implication is that regular check-ins with stakeholders can help align project goals and enhance overall efficiency.
lenses.engineer: From a technical perspective, engaging with stakeholders allows engineers to gather valuable insights that can shape project requirements. This feedback loop can lead to more effective solutions and avoid costly revisions later. While the article doesnâ€™t emphasize specific models or benchmarks, the importance of communication in technical projects is clear.
